result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ernest Vincent Davis

defendant.name: Davis, Ernest Vincent

records.addlTxt:
AMENDED

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

10:07 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ernest V. Davis in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Ernest V. Davis. INCLUDES 22CF236, 22TR493, 22TR506 and 22TR507. Set for PLEAS. Atty. Satorius states that DE is participating in a recovery program, there is a possible agreement which includes pre-payment of restitution, DE needs additional time to come up with money, requests 2 months for PLEAS. Atty. Satorius requests bond modification regarding testing. ADA Rockow does not object. Court modifies bond. Court sets PLEAS. Adjourned: 10:11 AM. kma
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 2, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Restitution. Filed by VW.  gll

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least TWO times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:52 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY:  Abrianna Dolfi, DF:  Ernest V. Davis appeared. DE qualifies for PD. INCLUDES 22CF236, 22TR493, 22TR506 and 22TR507. OFF RECORD to allow Atty. Dolfi to review complaint. 1:54 pm - Case recalled. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. ADA Rockow requests bond. Atty. Dolfi makes bond argument, DE has difficulty with transportation. Court sets bond. 22TR493, 22TR506 and 22TR507: NG. Court sets STC for attorney status, SETC and PSC. Adjourned: 2:00 PM. kma  Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Settlement conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
